20101229170758.000|20101229170800.000|TR0|his customers, and this has been very good 
20101229170800.000|20101229170803.000|TR0|for his business.  So that's good to know.
20101229170803.000|20101229170805.000|TR0|
20101229170805.000|20101229170808.000|TR0|I know it isn't easy to be a small 
20101229170808.000|20101229170811.000|TR0|business owner or manager. And it isn't

20101229170813.000|20101229170816.000|TR0|

20101229170818.000|20101229170821.000|TR0|getting out to work and to stores like 
20101229170821.000|20101229170824.000|TR0|this one, but Nick seems to be faring a 
20101229170824.000|20101229170826.000|TR0|little bit better.  Not being able to get 
20101229170826.000|20101229170829.000|TR0|to the stores can mean lost income for 
20101229170829.000|20101229170831.000|TR0|small businesses and lost pay for workers. 
20101229170831.000|20101229170834.000|TR0| And at a time when so many families are 
20101229170834.000|20101229170836.000|TR0|struggling to keep up with the bills, the 
20101229170836.000|20101229170839.000|TR0|blizzard has not made life any easier.
20101229170839.000|20101229170842.000|TR0|
20101229170842.000|20101229170844.000|TR0|Our city is using every single resource at 
20101229170844.000|20101229170847.000|TR0|our disposal, and many more that we have 
20101229170847.000|20101229170849.000|TR0|borrowed and hired to get the five 
20101229170849.000|20101229170852.000|TR0|boroughs back up and running, but 
20101229170852.000|20101229170855.000|TR0|obviously we still have a lot more work 
20101229170855.000|20101229170857.000|TR0|ahead of us. Over the past 24 hours, 
20101229170857.000|20101229170900.000|TR0|thousands of sanitation workers and other 
20101229170900.000|20101229170902.000|TR0|city workers have made steady progress.  
20101229170902.000|20101229170905.000|TR0|And I want to thank the private workers 
20101229170905.000|20101229170908.000|TR0|and laborers who are helping us dig the 
20101229170908.000|20101229170910.000|TR0|city out.
20101229170910.000|20101229170913.000|TR0|
20101229170913.000|20101229170915.000|TR0|Yesterday, we hired nearly 700 laborers to 
20101229170915.000|20101229170918.000|TR0|shovel out bus stops and crosswalks.  And 
20101229170918.000|20101229170920.000|TR0|today, we have hired about 1,200 more 
20101229170920.000|20101229170923.000|TR0|laborers to continue that work, and we'll 
20101229170923.000|20101229170926.000|TR0|do the same thing tomorrow.       I will 
20101229170926.000|20101229170928.000|TR0|say that on Christmas Day and each day 
20101229170928.000|20101229170931.000|TR0|afterwards, when we called on our city 
20101229170931.000|20101229170933.000|TR0|workers to come in, they answered the call 
20101229170933.000|20101229170936.000|TR0|and we had phenomenal response.  It was a 
20101229170936.000|20101229170939.000|TR0|little bit harder to get some of the 
20101229170939.000|20101229170941.000|TR0|private sector workers in on Christmas Day 
20101229170941.000|20101229170944.000|TR0|and the day after, but that's now been 
20101229170944.000|20101229170946.000|TR0|rectified, and they're helping as well.
20101229170946.000|20101229170949.000|TR0|
20101229170949.000|20101229170952.000|TR0|We also had 28 giant front-end loaders 
20101229170952.000|20101229170954.000|TR0|from private contractors working during 
20101229170954.000|20101229170957.000|TR0|the night.  They helped us dig out 
20101229170957.000|20101229170959.000|TR0|vehicles that have been stuck in the snow. 
20101229170959.000|20101229171002.000|TR0| There are still about 50 stuck MTA buses 
20101229171002.000|20101229171004.000|TR0|remaining, but that is down from 600 early 
20101229171004.000|20101229171007.000|TR0|yesterday.
20101229171007.000|20101229171010.000|TR0|
20101229171010.000|20101229171012.000|TR0|City--wide, we think we have got 99 
20101229171012.000|20101229171015.000|TR0|percent of primary streets plowed, 86 
20101229171015.000|20101229171017.000|TR0|percent of secondary roads, and 66 percent 
20101229171017.000|20101229171020.000|TR0|of tertiary roads.  There are still 
20101229171020.000|20101229171023.000|TR0|unplowed residential streets in five 
20101229171023.000|20101229171025.000|TR0|boroughs, particularly in South Brooklyn, 
20101229171025.000|20101229171028.000|TR0|where we've only gotten to 96 percent of 
20101229171028.000|20101229171030.000|TR0|the primary roads, 63 percent of the 
20101229171030.000|20101229171033.000|TR0|secondary roads, and 27 percent of the 
20101229171033.000|20101229171036.000|TR0|tertiary roads.  And we also have some 
20101229171036.000|20101229171038.000|TR0|areas in western Queens and Staten Island 
20101229171038.000|20101229171041.000|TR0|that still need a lot of work.
20101229171041.000|20101229171043.000|TR0|
20101229171043.000|20101229171046.000|TR0|These are all residential areas where, 
20101229171046.000|20101229171048.000|TR0|often, more vehicles are stuck in the snow 
20101229171048.000|20101229171051.000|TR0|and abandoned.  And that's really been the 
20101229171051.000|20101229171054.000|TR0|key difference that we can point to so far 
20101229171054.000|20101229171056.000|TR0|between this snowstorm and others.  An 
20101229171056.000|20101229171059.000|TR0|enormously larger number of stuck buses, 
20101229171059.000|20101229171101.000|TR0|trucks, cars. And if there is one car in 
20101229171101.000|20101229171104.000|TR0|the middle of a block, you just can't do 
20101229171104.000|20101229171107.000|TR0|anything.  We even have to many times get 
20101229171107.000|20101229171109.000|TR0|a front-end loader in to shovel enough or 
20101229171109.000|20101229171112.000|TR0|dig enough snow out so that the tow truck 
20101229171112.000|20101229171114.000|TR0|can get in. And if you can't get the tow 
20101229171114.000|20101229171117.000|TR0|truck in, you can't get the car out and 
20101229171117.000|20101229171120.000|TR0|you can't plow.
20101229171120.000|20101229171122.000|TR0|
20101229171122.000|20101229171125.000|TR0|Why that was different this time, we're 
20101229171125.000|20101229171127.000|TR0|not sure.  We will do the postmortem 
20101229171127.000|20101229171130.000|TR0|afterwards.
20101229171130.000|20101229171132.000|TR0|
20101229171132.000|20101229171135.000|TR0|In the meantime, what we're trying to do 
20101229171135.000|20101229171138.000|TR0|is get the resources that will let us get 
20101229171138.000|20101229171140.000|TR0|them out.  The police department provided 
20101229171140.000|20101229171143.000|TR0|70 tow trucks, and even drove out to the 
20101229171143.000|20101229171145.000|TR0|tow truck drivers' homes to bring them in

20101229171148.000|20101229171151.000|TR0|made an enormous difference.

20101229171750.000|20101229171753.000|TR0|Still to come, it seems the length of your

20101229171803.000|20101229171806.000|TR0|saying.
20101229171806.000|20101229171809.000|TR0|

20101229171811.000|20101229171814.000|TR0|Cohen will bring you the details.
20101229171814.000|20101229171816.000|TR0|
20101229171816.000|20101229171819.000|TR0|(COMMERCIAL BREAK)
20101229171819.000|20101229171822.000|TR0|
20101229171822.000|20101229171824.000|TR0|HARRIS:  Well, we're all trying to figure 
20101229171824.000|20101229171827.000|TR0|this next one out.  For centuries, people 
20101229171827.000|20101229171829.000|TR0|have read their hands to find out their 
20101229171829.000|20101229171832.000|TR0|fate.  Now a British study finds a 
20101229171832.000|20101229171834.000|TR0|possible link between the length of your 
20101229171834.000|20101229171837.000|TR0|fingers and prostate cancer risk.
20101229171837.000|20101229171840.000|TR0|
20101229171840.000|20101229171842.000|TR0|Senior Medical Correspondent Elizabeth 
20101229171842.000|20101229171845.000|TR0|Cohen joins us now with details.
20101229171845.000|20101229171847.000|TR0|
20101229171847.000|20101229171850.000|TR0|And Elizabeth, every guy on the doggoned 
20101229171850.000|20101229171853.000|TR0|set is looking at and checking the length 
20101229171853.000|20101229171855.000|TR0|of their fingers and trying to figure out 
20101229171855.000|20101229171858.000|TR0|what this all means.  And what did the 
20101229171858.000|20101229171900.000|TR0|study find?
20101229171900.000|20101229171903.000|TR0|
20101229171903.000|20101229171906.000|TR0|ELIZABETH COHEN, CNN SENIOR MEDICAL 
20101229171906.000|20101229171908.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Oh, this is such a bizarre 
20101229171908.000|20101229171911.000|TR0|study, so let's get right to what exactly 
20101229171911.000|20101229171913.000|TR0|the results were.
20101229171913.000|20101229171916.000|TR0|
20101229171916.000|20101229171918.000|TR0|All right.  First of all, anyone can take 
20101229171918.000|20101229171921.000|TR0|a look at their hands and see that the 
20101229171921.000|20101229171924.000|TR0|index and the ring finger, the two fingers 
20101229171924.000|20101229171926.000|TR0|on either side of the middle finger, one 
20101229171926.000|20101229171929.000|TR0|is probably longer than the other.  And it 
20101229171929.000|20101229171931.000|TR0|varies with different people.  Sometimes 
20101229171931.000|20101229171934.000|TR0|the ring is longer, sometimes the index is 
20101229171934.000|20101229171937.000|TR0|longer, sometimes they're equal.
20101229171937.000|20101229171939.000|TR0|
20101229171939.000|20101229171942.000|TR0|What they found in this British study is 
20101229171942.000|20101229171944.000|TR0|that men whose ring fingers were longer 
20101229171944.000|20101229171947.000|TR0|than their index finger were more likely 
20101229171947.000|20101229171950.000|TR0|to get prostate cancer.  However, if their 
20101229171950.000|20101229171952.000|TR0|index was longer than their ring finger, 
20101229171952.000|20101229171955.000|TR0|and if the opposite was true, in other 
20101229171955.000|20101229171957.000|TR0|words, they were 33 percent less likely to 
20101229171957.000|20101229172000.000|TR0|get prostate cancer.
20101229172000.000|20101229172002.000|TR0|
20101229172002.000|20101229172005.000|TR0|HARRIS:  What?
20101229172005.000|20101229172008.000|TR0|
20101229172008.000|20101229172010.000|TR0|COHEN:  And it's just so bizarre, but 
20101229172010.000|20101229172013.000|TR0|that's what they found looking at 
20101229172013.000|20101229172015.000|TR0|thousands of people.
20101229172015.000|20101229172018.000|TR0|
20101229172018.000|20101229172021.000|TR0|HARRIS:  Well, as I look at my fingers 
20101229172021.000|20101229172023.000|TR0|here, why on earth would this be the case? 
20101229172023.000|20101229172026.000|TR0| How do you come up with this kind of 
20101229172026.000|20101229172028.000|TR0|linkage?
20101229172028.000|20101229172031.000|TR0|
20101229172031.000|20101229172034.000|TR0|COHEN:  All right.  Here's the theory, 
20101229172034.000|20101229172036.000|TR0|Tony.
20101229172036.000|20101229172039.000|TR0|
20101229172039.000|20101229172041.000|TR0|First, we will start with the finding.  
20101229172041.000|20101229172044.000|TR0|They have found that men who get prostate 
20101229172044.000|20101229172046.000|TR0|cancer tend to have more testosterone in 
20101229172046.000|20101229172049.000|TR0|their systems.  They also have found that 
20101229172049.000|20101229172052.000|TR0|there may be a link between how much 
20101229172052.000|20101229172054.000|TR0|testosterone you were exposed to in your 
20101229172054.000|20101229172057.000|TR0|mother's womb and how long your fingers 
20101229172057.000|20101229172059.000|TR0|are.
20101229172059.000|20101229172102.000|TR0|
20101229172102.000|20101229172105.000|TR0|I know it sounds weird, but the length of 
20101229172105.000|20101229172107.000|TR0|your fingers, it happens when you're in 
20101229172107.000|20101229172110.000|TR0|the womb.  There is nothing you can do 
20101229172110.000|20101229172112.000|TR0|about it.  And there is some evidence that 
20101229172112.000|20101229172115.000|TR0|shows that the more testosterone in your 
20101229172115.000|20101229172118.000|TR0|mother's system, the longer that ring 
20101229172118.000|20101229172120.000|TR0|finger is going to be.
20101229172120.000|20101229172123.000|TR0|
20101229172123.000|20101229172125.000|TR0|And so there does seem to be some -- there 
20101229172125.000|20101229172128.000|TR0|is some sense here. But, you know, this is 
20101229172128.000|20101229172130.000|TR0|a study that's really in its infancy.  We 
20101229172130.000|20101229172133.000|TR0|can't say for sure, oh, boy, you guys with 
20101229172133.000|20101229172136.000|TR0|the long ring fingers, boy are you in 
20101229172136.000|20101229172138.000|TR0|trouble.  We would never say that, but it 
20101229172138.000|20101229172141.000|TR0|is certainly an intriguing theory, that 
20101229172141.000|20101229172143.000|TR0|your finger length may just be a marker 
20101229172143.000|20101229172146.000|TR0|for how much testosterone you have running 
20101229172146.000|20101229172149.000|TR0|around your body.
20101229172149.000|20101229172151.000|TR0|
20101229172151.000|20101229172154.000|TR0|HARRIS:  And there is nothing you're going 
20101229172154.000|20101229172156.000|TR0|to do about it.  I mean, come on.  Right?
20101229172156.000|20101229172159.000|TR0|
20101229172159.000|20101229172202.000|TR0|COHEN:  No, there is nothing you're going 
20101229172202.000|20101229172204.000|TR0|to do.  So this is just sort of more 
20101229172204.000|20101229172207.000|TR0|interesting.
20101229172207.000|20101229172209.000|TR0|
20101229172209.000|20101229172212.000|TR0|HARRIS:  There you go.
20101229172212.000|20101229172214.000|TR0|
20101229172214.000|20101229172217.000|TR0|COHEN:  There's really nothing you're 
20101229172217.000|20101229172220.000|TR0|going to do.
20101229172220.000|20101229172222.000|TR0|
20101229172222.000|20101229172225.000|TR0|But I do want to take this opportunity, 
20101229172225.000|20101229172227.000|TR0|Tony, to tell men that they need to talk 
20101229172227.000|20101229172230.000|TR0|to their doctor about prostate cancer 
20101229172230.000|20101229172233.000|TR0|screening.
20101229172233.000|20101229172235.000|TR0|
20101229172235.000|20101229172238.000|TR0|HARRIS:  Yes.
20101229172238.000|20101229172240.000|TR0|
20101229172240.000|20101229172243.000|TR0|COHEN:  I don't care how long your fingers 
20101229172243.000|20101229172246.000|TR0|are.  I don't care if you don't even have 
20101229172246.000|20101229172248.000|TR0|fingers.  You need to talk to your doctor.
20101229172248.000|20101229172251.000|TR0|
20101229172251.000|20101229172253.000|TR0|I know men hate to do this.  But if you go 
20101229172253.000|20101229172256.000|TR0|to CNN.com/empoweredpatient, you can learn 
20101229172256.000|20101229172258.000|TR0|everything you need to know about the 
20101229172258.000|20101229172301.000|TR0|discussion you need to have with your 
20101229172301.000|20101229172304.000|TR0|doctor.  In fact, we asked four male 
20101229172304.000|20101229172306.000|TR0|experts what kind of screening do you get,
